choices: Snotz-Platz, the headquarters of the Gobz-Natz
The toilet…you’ve been wanting to go for an hour now…
Go tell what you’ve heard to your best (only) bud - Gomez
1.content:
You are Chuck Montizuma (your friends call you Monti…well your one friend anyway), space-cadet and student of the Interstellar Space Academy. You are studying for your final exam, which will be a six hour theory paper followed by a four hour physical exam. Ten out of every thousand students pass the exam to become Space Rangers…the rest become space genitors…at the moment you are not too positive about your prospects.

Returning your thoughts to the three terra-bytes of work that you still have to go through, you hear star fleet Admiral Maximus Potentius talking to one of his subordinates outside your door. “If we don’t recover the Star Nexus, it will be our end. We need a hero for this, but we cannot find our number one Space Ranger, Sam Sloane.”

“Missing in action sir”, the subordinate asks. “No. A month ago, for his bachelors his buddies dumped his intoxicated body into a crate and mailed him to the outer rim…we’ve not been able to find him since.”

“I heard a rumour the Star Nexus was stolen by the Gobz-Natz and is being held in the dark marshes of Doomsdunder”, his subordinate says. Quickly checking your books you see that Doomsdunder is a dark and dangerous planet. The Gobz-Natz is an evil breed of alien, with a particular disliking of humans…except when it comes to human flesh which they will gladly prepare in any variety of ways as per their “Universal Cookbook for Humans and all other Inferior Creatures”.

Before you can hear anything else, a passer-by scares them away. Your mind races at the speed of light. If you recover the Star Nexus (whatever that is), they will instantly make you a Space Ranger. You figure that your odds are much better of becoming a Space Ranger by braving the Gobz-Natz, than by passing the exam. You realize you could sneak into the launch-deck and highjack a transporter, but where will you go?
1.title: To study or not to study...

choices: Jam your hand in below the dashboard and yank out some wires.
Fake Admiral Maximus Potentius’s voice and start yelling.
Tell the computer your life story and ask it to help.
11.content:
You run to the launch-deck and hide behind some crates. Then you spot an empty ship of the Fast Attack and Recognisance Troops, also known as the FARTs. Perfect. Jumping in, you start the engine and slip away into space.

“Computer, take me to the dark marshes of Doomsdunder”, you ask, having forgotten the interface protocols you just studied.

“The what…”, the computer asks.

“The dark marshes of Doomsdunder...Doomsdunder...”

“Yeah”, the computer starts, “I don’t think you’re authorized to fly this ship, so I’m gonna head on over back to the mother-ship.”
11.title: The dark marshes of Doomsdunder

choices: The dreaded Dark Marshes of Doomsdunder.
The dreaded Dark Marshes of Doomsdunder, but...
113.content:
“Look” you say, trying to appeal to the computer’s sympathy circuits, “If I retrieve the Star Nexus from the Dark Marshes of Doomsdunder and return it to the Space Academy, I’ll be a hero and automatically become a Space Ranger. It’s all I ever wanted to be!” Your eyes mist up and your voice cracks a little as you reminisce. “When I was a young boy growing up on the algae farms of Ag326 I used to watch ‘Tales of Galactic Patrol’ on the Tri-Dee. My friends and I would pretend to be patrolmen on the Acturas border, and set up empty Bio-Nutri-Aid crates as road blocks and checkpoints. Then we’d pretend that the pre-programed waste-carrier Bots were Agrean blockade runners as they smashed trough them without stopping, and we’d shoot at them with our photon pistols, well, bent sticks we would pretend were photon pistols, cause we couldn’t afford the officially merchandised ‘Galactic Patrol’ action sets that the rich kids who lived in the pumping sector would deck themselves out with…”
“All right, all right! The computer interrupts in exasperation. “I’ll take you to the marshes! Just stop with the old home reminiscing already. Cripes,” the synthesized voice mutters, “it’s no wonder we human interface systems have such a high rate of self disconnection.”
At that, the computer engages the hyper-drive and you experience that queer swirling sensation that is both the hallmark and bane of hyper-space travel; the feeling that marked the start of every hyper-space trip. It was a bit like a feeling of being swallowed like a glass of water. For a short while you’re not sure if you started out half full or half empty, only that you are definitely flat. And tepid. The feeling soon passes, and you settle down to the mind numbing boredom of hyper-travel.
A couple of times during the 20 minute journey you attempt to query the computer, only to have the navigation screen flash the words ‘Can’t talk right now, busy navigating’ at you. At long last, you feel the un-mistakable sensation of being regurgitated (the one other distinctly unique experience of hyper-space travel that marks the end) and your trip is over. You gaze out the view port at..
113.title: Tell the computer your life story and ask it to...

1131.content:
Outside, you see the planet known as Doomsdunder. It looks dark and foreboding. Cold sweat pearls on your forehead.


“Computer”, you stammer with a dry mouth, “I think we’d better get back home…you were right, I’m not authorised to be here.”

“Screw that”, the computer replies to your surprise. “You dragged me all the way here…now you’re going down there to get the Star Nexus.”

With that the Artificial Intelligence Processor starts flashing, followed by the ‘Personnel Transportation Beam’ that activates.

“Don’t you dare”, is all you manage to say before the beam commences to disintegrate you into electromagnetic pulses that will reassemble your body on the planet’s surface. In a last ditch attempt to stop the computer you hit the “Abort” button…but alas it’s too late. You materialise on the planet’s surface…only to find something is wrong.
1131.title: The dreaded Dark Marshes of Doomsdunder.

choices: Assume the Attack Stance and threaten the evil villain
Take a nap while you ride on the Gobz-Natz's back
11311.content:
Looking down you are horrified to see your ass where your crotch used to be.

“Don’t be mad at me”, you hear the Computer say over your communicator. “You slammed on the ‘Abort’ button while the process was underway – now you ended up with your ass on the wrong side of your body.”

“So fix it”, you cry in a high-pitched voice.

“No-way”, the Computer replies coolly. “First find the Star Nexus, then I’ll beam you up. And if I were you I’d stop whining, there’s a patrol of Gobz-Natz heading towards you, and if they find you, you might as well bend over and kiss your own ass goodbye.”

Before you can respond, you hear something in the bushes behind you. You turn around to see the meanest looking Gobz-Natz trooper look at you, followed by a reinforced-fibre net that entraps you.

“We take ass-man to our leader”, he mumbles in a course voice as he walks closer. Falling down, trapped in the net, you are unable to escape.

“Ass-man make good supper. Me never eat ass-man before. Now we go bye-bye.”
11311.title: What the...?

113111.content:
You think back to your 2nd year classes, where a combat teacher-bot had been showing the class various martial arts and describing how they could be used effectively against the various alien races.
"The 'White Crane' posture" the 'Bot had droned "not only provides an excellent starting pose for various moves that will kill the typical Gobz-Natz, it also mimics the posture of the dominant Gobz-Natz clan leader. The Gobz-Natz are descended from a race of pack-animals, and still react instinctively to what is seen as an Alpha, or dominant figure, instinctively turning submissive. A well prepared scout can take advantage of this instinctive behavior, which will allow you effectively get in the first strike and kill them."
This sounds like a really good idea at this point, so you...
113111.title: Assume the Attack Stance and threaten the evil ...

choices: Something happens and you don't reach the Main Base
1131111.content:
You decide to leap up and strike the fearsome 'White Crane' stance, driving terror into the hearts (or what ever circulatory organs they have, alien biology wasn’t one of you strong subjects). Yes, you will kill them and make good your escape.
Your brilliant plan is spoiled only by the fact that you are lying on the ground tightly wrapped by a reinforced-fibre net that entraps you. Your attempts at movement trigger the net's 'Prey-O-Torment' (Pat Pending) circuits, which zaps your muscles and causes you to writhe spasmodically, to the great amusement of your captor.
He spends an entertaining (for him) couple of hours watching you suffer, poking you encouragingly when your struggles slow down. Eventually, he gets bored of this and drags you off to the Gobz-Natz Main Base.
1131111.title: Use the 'White Crane' Stance

11311111.content: "You arrive at the Main Base"
11311111.title: You Reach the Main Base

1131112.content:
In class room exercises your attempts at the 'White Crane' pose more often looked like the 'Desperate to Get Laid Submissive Female' pose, and you definitely don't want to make that mistake a third time.
You opt for the lesser known 'Panting Dog', which gives you the advantage of being in a crouch position ready to start running the moment the opportunity presents itself.
You draw your body into the correct posture (hampered slightly by your hips being on backward) and wait for the opportunity to make your escape.
1131112.title: Use the 'Panting Dog' Stance

choices: You arrive at the Main Base
Something else happens, and you don't arrive at the Main Base
11311121.content:
Unfortunately, Your brilliant escape plan is spoiled by the fact that you are tightly wrapped by a reinforced-fibre net that entraps you. Your attempts at movement trigger the net's 'Prey-O-Torment' (Pat Pending) circuits, which zaps your muscles and causes you to writhe spasmodically, to the great amusement of your captor.
After he's finished laughing (which takes a long time) he drags you off to the Gobz-Natz Main Base.
11311121.title: The Opportunity comes.

113111211.content:
After what seems like ages of being half carried, half dragged over every rock on the path, your captor crests a low hill and starts down towards what at first appears to be a smoldering garbage dump. As you are painfully dragged closer you realize that is actually a military base camp, although one that looked like it was designed by a first year architecture student who was trying to achieve the impression of ugly, and way overshot the mark. Low buildings of cinder grey cement haphazardly surrounded central building that was a lozenge shaped monstrosity of Cind-R-Blok (registered trademark) and plaz-steel. You barely have time to think to yourself “Even Yankee Stadium wasn’t that ugly!” before the trooper drags you through the sickly smelling smog into one of the larger building on the outskirts of the base. Once inside your dumped onto the floor as the roll up entrance door rattles noisily closed. Once it locks, the Gobz-Natz trooper pulls a remote control from his pocket, presses a button, and the fiber net drops off you.
You try to get up, but before you can make your protesting muscles move the trooper…
113111211.title: You arrive at the Main Base

1131112111.content: Opens the door to a...
1131112111.title: Caged!

choices: See what you have to eat
Take a piss, it's been a while
11311121111.content:
The Gobz-Natz trooper picks you up and pushes you through a wire mesh door at the end of the room. You stumble and fall to your knees as the door slams closed behind you. Getting to your feet you look around at the large cage you are now in. Made of heavy wire mesh, Plaz-Glass, and cement, it’s main attraction is an algae covered drinking fountain in one corner. Another corner looks like it has been used as a toilet by countless other captives, since departed. Indeed, although the area was relatively clear of fecal matter, at least large deposits of it, it appeared that urine had been left in a slowly drying puddle, adding a certain, shall we call it, atmosphere to the place. You wryly note that the puddle of urine had become so concentrated that the powdery residue around the edge had actually etched into the cement.
You sit in a third, relatively clean corner and take stock of your situation. The first thing to do, you decide, is to take an inventory of everything you have at your disposal.
A thorough examination of all the tools at your disposal takes a discouragingly brief period of time. You have:
Two mechanical pencils.
One ships communicator
One ‘Sur-Viv-All’ all purpose survival, first aid, and quality entertainment kit (The Marooned Space-mans Best Friend, pat pending)
Lots of dirt from being dragged over every rock on the way here
A grimy much folded piece of paper.
One basic student’s one-piece uniform coverall (your wearing that).
You sit back and contemplate your situation. It looks pretty hopeless.
You think back and try to remember what your instructors in escapology taught you. Most of it was pretty much useless at the moment, as it required pocket lasers, micro-fiber wire, blasting plastique, or a squad of space marines, your basic minimum of equipment.
The only thing that comes to mind was the voice of your old drill instructor, a veteran of several successful battles (successful in that more than half the troops returned alive and relatively whole, for a given value of whole)
“A good soldier Never” he was fond of saying “misses the opportunity to sleep, eat, or have a piss.”
Thus inspired you…
11311121111.title: Large Cage

113111211111.content:
You decide you might as well eat something. Perhaps an escape plan will occure to you as you munch down ‘Cadet Brand Nutri-O-Bar’, the one nutrition bar guaranteed to lessen your hunger (quite true, as the thought of eating a second was often enough to make you decide you’re really not that hungry).
You start to wipe your hands on the sides of your dirt covered uniform and find they are covered with a yellowish foul smelling powder. Great, it looks like the Gobz-Natz trooper dragged you through a pile of sulfur on your way here. You shake as much of the yellow dust as you can out of your clothes, then open the Sur-Viv-All pack to see what’s for dinner.

One of the wonders of the Sur-Viv-All kit was the Metabolic Universatility Compound Kit. MUCK was a series of sprays that you applied to anything you thought might be edible, and chemical agents in the spray(s) would combine with any and all toxins, or other biological incompatible compounds, and render them harmless. Once the process was complete, a chromatic indicator let you know you could now consume that item. In other words, if the meat was green, it was safe to eat.
One of the side effects of eating such treated food was that the human bowels often reacted by producing an excessive amount of intestinal gas. This, combined with the cramped conditions onboard ship escape pods during emergency evacuation, often lead to statements like “Jees dud! If you have to do that, do it outside!” Since atmosphere suits were often not included in these invitations, offenders rarely got a third chance to apologize.
Thus was the decision made to include charcoal biscuits to absorb and neutralize any possible flatulence causing gasses. The manufacture claimed that the biscuits were not only effective, but tasty and nutritious as well. On an Odd side note, the executive in charge of advertising for ‘Dad’s Own Willow Charcoal Brand’ was recently indicted for failure to declare income from sales of over 350 of his grandmother’s ‘gently enjoyed’ atmospheric runabouts (used only to visit her worship planetoid on Sundays, and all with only slightly more than 10,000 kilo-parsecs on the clock)
The danger of deathly flatulence was why, as you rummage amongst the colourfully decorated (one couldn’t possibly use the phrase ‘tastefully decorated’ without risking the wrath of the Goddess Morissette, patron Saint of irony) packages of Sust-In-All E-Ration (Trademark applied for) you see a jumbo sized box of ‘Dad’s Own’ Biscuits.

You stare for a minute at the label, as something important wriggles beneath the surface of your memory, something learned, under hypnosis, in a chemistry class long, long ago and far, far away. Something about Urinic acid, and charcoal, and sulfur. What was it???…
113111211111.title: See what you have to eat

1131112111111.content:
It suddenly hits you. Charcoal equals Carbon. Uric Acid equals Salt Peter. Carbon, Salt Peter and Sulfur combined equals Gun Powder, which equals big bang, which equals unlocked door and freedom.
Quickly you scrape together all the discarded sulfur, then an equal amount of urine powder from the corner. After biting off a third, equal amount of biscuit, you use the heel of your boot to grind the whole mess into a fine powder. Hoping that you had the percentages correct, you tightly wrap the gray powder in the worn paper, which you jam into the crack under the door. With a quick prayer to St. Juan Valdez (patron saint of all who must study for exams) you take the quality entertainment lighter and touch the flame to the thin tendril of paper trailing from under the door, then dash to the far side of the cage and cover your ears.
1131112111111.title: Remember

1131112111112.content:
You lean against the wall as events from your past parade across your mind. Slowly, a mental image forms of people, and hot dogs, and a pot of bubbling tomatoes. Why do you keep thinking of sulfuric smelling tomatoes?
Wait a minute. Sulfur! Charcoal. That recipe for your great uncle Jack’s authentic Australian style Taiwanese Tex-Mex Chili !!.
Earth was a long time ago, but traditionalists still observed the old traditional holidays: Xmas, Earth Hog Day, Spring Break, Easter, Hollow Weed, Thanks for Shopping, and the mystical 4th of July. Chili, for some obscure reason, had come to be associated with the 4th; a holiday honoring the Great Prophet Rushmore (a 4 headed giant said to have lead the faithful to a bountiful land overflowing with milk and honey, where he gave them dominion over the birds of the air, the beasts of the land, the fish of the waters, and stewardship over the less fortunate and backwards peoples, back in the days when all those things still existed.)
Every year Uncle Jack would dig out the dog eared, badly stained and almost unreadable recipe book that was his family heirloom. The book wasn’t the original, which had disintegrated to dust long in the distant past. Instead, successive generations had faithfully copied and translated the pages as the old ones tore, faded, caught fire, dissolved, or were otherwise damaged. Who the author Anna Christ was, and why her cook book came to be associated with that particular holiday, was a mystery. You had always meant to ask Uncle Jack about that, but had never gotten around to it. And then had come that fateful day when, after eating the entire pot himself because, as he had put it, the other relatives at the picnic were un-educated heathens that lacked the sophistication to appreciated the fine art of traditional cooking, he had struck a lit match to a Nic-O-Stick, inhaled, and vanished in a very loud cloud of smoke. (The resultant crater is fondly called ‘Jack’s Lake’ and is quite a popular fishing spot).
You sigh, and shake your head. Reminiscing was all very fine, but what you really needed to do was to think of a way to get out of this cage.
Then you "Remember"  (click to continue)
1131112111112.title: Can't Remember

choices: Struggle Violently, hoping to knock the cage over
11311121112.content:
The Gobz-Natz trooper picks you up and stuffs you head first into a small cylindrical cage of heavy mesh wire. You slide to the bottom, and the weight of your body jams your neck to an extremely un-comfortable angle. The Gobz-Natz fastens a large rusty but quite adequate paddle lock to the cage door, and then writes something on the plate by your feet. He laughs and says “Bye bye Assman. I not be long, then we eat!”
Once he leaves the room you …
11311121112.title: Small Cage

1131112112.content:
The trooper stands a bit apart looking at you as you lay on the floor, a fine example of the academy's best work, or not. Wouldn't a real cadet have sprung lightly to the balls of his feet, ready to fight his way out in spite over whelming odds? Maybe you will get around to upholding the academy reputation later. Right now it's all you can do to move muscles that are screaming in agony.
The trooper looks at you and sneers "About time Assman get to Doomsdunder. Me been waiting six day now, and me getting…"
1131112112.title: Trooper speaks

choices: You arrive at the Main Base
You don't arrive at the main base
11311122.content: The Gobz-Natz trooper hoists you over his shoulder and carries you to the Gobz-Natz Main Base.
11311122.title: The Opportunity doesn't come.

choices: The interior of something that’s Really Dark
1133.content: a sight that was totally unexpected. Something has gon wrong, because out the viewport you see...
1133.title: Someplace else

choices: Stay put and hope for the best.
Why, worry. One can walk on tar, right?
12.content:
Remembering that there is a wormhole nearby that is said to exit near Snotz-Platz, you decide to try your luck. Quickly checking the space genitor’s Solid and Hard Implements Transfer list (or SHIT list), you see a cargo ship will fly past there, leaving within the hour.

Thirty minutes later, you find yourself stowed away in an escape pod on the transporter. As you approach the wormhole, you wait for the perfect moment before releasing the pod, and launching yourself into the wormhole.

Emerging on the other side, you wipe the vomit from your mouth (due to the bumpy wormhole ride), and look up to see the black and red planet called Snotz-Platz. You engage the atmosphere re-entry sequence and crash land in a tar pit. Your ship starts sinking into the tar.
12.title: Snotz-Platz, the headquarters of the Gobz-Natz

121.content:
Deciding to stick around for a while, you spot a crate in the corner and decide to investigate. You open it and browse through the contents. It’s your lucky day – a complete Space Ranger’s starter pack, including photon pistol, anti-gravity boots, multiple-vision goggles, survival kit and a twelve pack Bubbelicious-Space-Gum: apple flavour.

“Everything a hero needs”, you whisper to yourself as you kit up. The ship shudders.
You hear a loud gulp and see that the ship just sank another few inches into the tar. Sticking around is obviously not an option.

Activating your new anti-gravity boots, you hover over the tar pit and land on a clearing on the far side. Afoot-path leads away that forks left and right. Which way do you go?
121.title: Stay put and hope for the best.

choices: Go hang out at the water cooler
Check how your buddy Gomez is doing
Sit around some more and check out the magazine lying on the floor
13.content:
You stroll over to the toilet. Closing the door, you take a load off. You’ve been wanting to back this baby out since lunch. You start picking your nose. Then you discover it...yup, there it is. A nice fat booger, but it is just evading your probing finger...almost...almost...YES. Got it.
You roll it into a tiny ball and flick it away.
13.title: The toilet…you’ve been wanting to g...

choices: Ask the third guy if you can buy the paper from him
Release a stink fart and continue on your way
131.content:
You mosey on over to the water cooler. Upon you arrival you find three of your class mates discussing the upcoming exam.

“I’ve covered the work three times, complete test papers for the past ten years”, the first one says.
“I’ve done that twice”, the second one says.
“I’ve seen this year’s paper”, the last one says.

Suddenly your feeling of nausea disappears.
131.title: Go hang out at the water cooler

133.content:
Picking up the magazine titled ‘Space Ranger’s Digest’, you open it on the first page and scan the index.

“Hmmm...Making yourself inedible for the Gobz-Natz by eating excessive amounts of horseradish, page 10...Invisibility underwear by the labs of Jockie,page 15...Win a free holiday to the beautiful dark plains of Doomsdunder, page 30...Firing your photon pistol with deadly accuracy whislt being blindfolded, page 45”

Where do you page?

Page 10
Page 15
Page 30
Page 45
133.title: Sit around some more and check out the magazine...

14.content:
You decide you’ll probably die if you try to recover the Star Nexus and return your thoughts to your studies:

“Stranded on a desolate planet in the Delphi system, you discover a derelict type HVH-7221 cargo ship. Upon further investigation, you discover that the ion-flux transducer has a broken anti-gravity photon transponder. How do you manage to leave the planet?
A. Fix the ship by reversing the polarity on the anti-gravity photon transponder by magnetizing the ion-flux transducer through hot particle exposure using your photon pistol
B. Fix the ship by rewiring the avionics’ artificial intelligence central processing unit nullifying the need for the ion-flux transducer, mapping the rewiring sequence from chart 77-DR/2 memorized when studying the Basics of Artificial Intelligence Reprogramming handbook volume 5 of 62.
C. Forget fixing the ship, rather salvage the anti-matter from the auxiliary power source taking care to maintain it in a stable state by utilizing a simple super-string theory using polarized magnetrons from the gravity regulators, and create a reverse impression of an Aurora Borealis and signal your mother ship that came to inspect the atmospheric anomaly, which is standard practice for the Delphi system.
D. There’s no use. Activate you photon pistol and blow your brains out.”

You mark option “D”, close your study material, and decide to head for Doomsdunder.
14.title: Continue your studies

choices: Jam your hand in below the dashboard and yank out some wires.
Fake Admiral Maximus Potentius’s voice and start yelling.
Tell the computer your life story and ask it to help.
141.content:
You run to the launch-deck and hide behind some crates. Then you spot an empty ship of the Fast Attack and Recognisance Troops, also known as the FARTs. Perfect. Jumping in, you start the engine and slip away into space.

“Computer, take me to the dark marshes of Doomsdunder”, you ask, having forgotten the interface protocols you just studied.

“The what…”, the computer asks.

“The dark marshes of Doomsdunder...Doomsdunder...”

“Yeah”, the computer starts, “I don’t think you’re authorized to fly this ship, so I’m gonna head on over back to the mother-ship.”
141.title: Head for Doomsdunder

info.brief_description: Interactive satisfaction guarenteed. Be Monti for a while, you won't be disappointed.
info.description:
You are Chuck Montizuma , space-cadet and student of the Interstellar Space Academy.

Your lifelong dream is to become a Space Ranger. Here's your chance.

Write short, simple and funny. The adventure can be exciting or dull. No sex, little violence and little swearing.

Think slow, and keep it real.
